Wisdom: اصْطِنَاعُ الْكَفُورِ مِنْ أَعْظَمِ الْجُرْمِ
enWisdom: Doing good to an ingrate is from the greatest of crimes

Wisdom: الْكَرَامَةُ تُفْسِدُ مِنَ اللَّئِيمِ بِقَدْرِ [قَدْرَ] مَا تُصْلِحُ مِنَ الْكَرِيمِ
enWisdom: Benevolence from the wicked corrupts just as much as it reforms from the honourable

Wisdom: إِنَّ إِمْسَاكَ الْحَافِظِ أَجْمَلُ مِنْ بَذْلِ الْمُضَيِّعِ
enWisdom: Verily the withholding of preserver is more graceful than the giving of the squanderer

Wisdom: تَضْيِيعُ الْمَعْرُوفِ وَضْعُهُ فِي غَيْرِ عَرُوفٍ
enWisdom: Wasting benevolence is showing it to someone who does not comprehend [its value]

Wisdom: ظُلْمُ الْإِحْسَانِ وَضْعُهُ فِي غَيْرِ مَوْضِعِهِ
enWisdom: NULL

Wisdom: ظَلَمَ الْمَعْرُوفَ مَنْ وَضَعَهُ فِي غَيْرِ أَهْلِهِ
enWisdom: He who does a good turn to those who are undeserving of it has oppressed it

Wisdom: مَنْ أَسْدَى مَعْرُوفاً إِلَى غَيْرِ أَهْلِهِ ظَلَمَ مَعْرُوفَهُ
enWisdom: One who does good to the undeserving has wronged his goodness

Wisdom: لَا تَضَعَنَّ مَعْرُوفَكَ عِنْدَ غَيْرِ عَرُوفٍ
enWisdom: Never show your benevolence to the one who does not understand its value (or who is not good)

Wisdom: لَا خَيْرَ فِي الْمَعْرُوفِ إِلَى غَيْرِ عَرُوفٍ
enWisdom: There is no virtue in doing good to one who does not know its value

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الرَّذَائِلِ اصْطِنَاعُ الْأَرَاذِلِ
enWisdom: The pinnacle of depravity is doing good to the wicked

Wisdom: شَرُّ الْأَفْعَالِ مَا هَدَمَ الصَّنِيعَةَ
enWisdom: The worst action is that which destroys the good turn [that is done to others]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُرَبِّ مَعْرُوفَهُ فَقَدْ ضَيَّعَهُ
enWisdom: One who does not nurture his good turn has indeed lost it

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُرَبِّ مَعْرُوفَهُ فَكَأَنَّهُ لَمْ يَصْنَعْهُ
enWisdom: Whoever does not nurture his favour, then it is as if he did not bestow it

Wisdom: مِنْ أَعْظَمِ الْفَجَائِعِ إِضَاعَةُ الصَّنَائِعِ
enWisdom: One of the greatest afflictions is wasting good turns [on the undeserving]

Wisdom: مَرَبَّةُ الْمَعْرُوفِ أَحْسَنُ [خَيْرٌ] مِنِ ابْتِدَائِهِ
enWisdom: Nurturing a good turn [and completing it] is better than starting it [anew]

Wisdom: وَاضِعُ مَعْرُوفِهِ عِنْدَ غَيْرِ مُسْتَحِقِّهِ مُضَيِّعٌ لَهُ
enWisdom: Whoever places his goodness with the one who does not deserve it has wasted it

Wisdom: لَا تَصْطَنِعْ مَنْ يَكْفُرُ بِرَّكَ
enWisdom: Do not do a good turn to the one who is ungrateful for your kindness

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبْ مَنْ فَاتَهُ الْعَقْلُ وَلَا تَصْطَنِعْ مَنْ خَافَهُ الْأَصْلُ فَإِنَّ مَنْ لَا عَقْلَ لَهُ يَضُرُّكَ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَرَى أَنَّهُ يَنْفَعُكَ وَمَنْ لَا أَصْلَ لَهُ يُسِي‏ءُ إِلَى مَنْ يُحْسِنُ إِلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Do not accompany the one who has lost his mind and do not seek good from one who is betrayed by his roots, for the one who is insane will harm you while he thinks he is helping you and the one who does not have [virtuous] roots will do evil to the one who does good to him

Wisdom: لَا تَزْكُو الصَّنِيعَةُ مَعَ غَيْرِ أَصِيلٍ
enWisdom: Goodness does not thrive with the ignoble

Wisdom: لَا مَعْرُوفَ أَضْيَعُ مِنِ اصْطِنَاعِ الْكَفُورِ
enWisdom: There is no benevolence more misused than doing good to the ingrate
